page.title: 01STEWARTBY AND ENVIRONS
page.content:
Stewartby is situated to the south of Bedford. The village lacks amenities because of the proximity to Bedford. Stewartby exists because of the long established brickworks, which provide employment for the majority of the village. Unfortunately, the area is spoilt by the pollution and extraction caused by such an industry.
The housing in Stewartby belongs to the works which built the houses at the same time, making the layout very regular.
Even aspects of the environment are affected by the brickworks, for example the lake is a filled-in quarry. Living and working together understandably makes people insular.
